sentences.en: Her face looked strained and weary.
sentences.cn: 她的脸色显得憔悴疲惫。

sentences.en: His laughter seemed a little strained.
sentences.cn: 他的笑声好像有点不自然。

sentences.en: His voice had lost its resonance; it was tense and strained.
sentences.cn: 他的声音不再洪亮，而是显得紧张，不太自然。

sentences.en: I couldn’t stand the strained atmosphere at dinner any more.
sentences.cn: 我再也忍受不了饭桌上的那种紧张气氛了。

sentences.en: If the eyes are severely strained , they become bloodshot.
sentences.cn: 如果眼睛过于疲劳就会充血.

sentences.en: Relations are rather strained at present.
Relations between the two countries had become severely strained.
sentences.cn: 两国关系已经变得非常紧张.

sentences.en: Resources will be further strained by new demands for housing.
sentences.cn: 资源将因新的住房需求而变得更紧张。

sentences.en: She looked a little pale and strained.
sentences.cn: 她看起来面色有点苍白，神情忧虑。

sentences.en: Since their argument there had been a strained atmosphere between them.
sentences.cn: 自从吵架后,他们之间一直很紧张.

sentences.en: Smiling for the cameras, the two men strained to make small- talk.
sentences.cn: 两名男士微笑着面对镜头，东拉西扯着。

sentences.en: the increasingly strained relations between the French and German governments
sentences.cn: 法国政府和德国政府之间日趋紧张的关系

sentences.en: The middle button of his uniform jacket was strained over his belly.
sentences.cn: 制服上装中间的纽扣在他的肚子上绷得紧紧的。

sentences.en: Their five-year relationship was strained beyond breaking point.
sentences.cn: 他们五年的关系已经紧张到无法维系。

sentences.en: They strained the wire between two posts.
sentences.cn: 他们拉紧了两根电线杆之间的电线.

sentences.en: They strained their eyes, but saw nothing.
sentences.cn: 他们瞪大了双眼，但什么也没看到。

words.tran_cn: 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘
过滤器；松紧扣；用力拉的人，拉紧者
紧张的；勉强的；牵强附会的；滤过的

phrases.tran_cn: n. 应变状态；受力状态

trans.tran_cn: 紧张的，不友善的，经过滤的，态度不自然的，勉强的
trans.tran_en: a strained situation or behaviour is not relaxed, natural, or friendly

trans.tran_cn: 拉紧( strain的过去式和过去分词)，尽量利用，尽全力，过滤
